title: Firefox memory consumption
content: Dear all, this is only a question !! No bug or error or something like that. I installed Firefox on a Raspberry PI (model 3B) to display a single webpage from a local file. To show the current date and time (as a project start, later I want to sync a page from pc to Raspberry, thats why I use Firefox) now I recognized the memory consumption showed by the tool glances (see picture). My question is: is this not some what overkill for a single local hosted page ?? Javascript to show date and time: see picture May I use the wrong technology I'm not sure, or is this behave not normal ? Regards, Olaf
creator: olaf.stute

title: (Linux Mint 20) plugin installation via script
content:
Hello support team, I need to install Firefox plugins via script for all users. The script works as follows:

  • download the ".xpi" file of the plugin
  • get the plugin ID from within the "manifest.json" file (<"id":> tag)
  • rename the ".xpi" file to the plugin ID (ending of the plugin file after renaming is still ".xpi")
  • copy the plugin into the "/usr/lib/firefox-addons/extensions" folder

This works for plugins which contains their ID inside the "manifest.json" file. But how do I find out the so called "permanent-id" of plugins where the ID is missing inside the "manifest.json"?

Regards

Ansgar
creator: firefox1173

title: How to remove the "Other Bookmarks" folder from the bar
content: When I started firefox today, there was a new folder added to my bookmarks toolbar - "Other Bookmarks". It was never there before and I want to remove it. In the bookmarks menu itself I have the "Bookmarks Toolbar" where I put the stuff I want to access often, and "Other Bookmarks" where I put other stuff I don't need as much. I don't see a reason why the "Other Bookmarks" should take up space on the bar.
creator: kgs.void

title: App Mode is disabled for localhost site in firefox
content: I have a web based application which I want to open in a separate window in app mode. I tried updating browser.ssb.enabled to true in config. I was able to run other websites in app mode but not able to run my application using localhost.

title: Firefox Won't Load ANY webpages - almost entirely unusable
content:
I was using firefox just fine, watching a youtube video when suddenly my video froze. I refreshed my webpage and youtube altogether will no longer load. I'm met with a white screen.

My firefox browser will no longer load most websites I try to go to. (neither will Chrome, but Edge seems to work just fine).

Now when I try to google something, I get a white screen. I try to go to reddit or other websites and i'm met with a white page filled with unicode characters. My browser was working JUST fine about an hour ago and out of nowhere it will now load nothing. I'm at my wit's end trying to figure out what is going on.

Society6.com is the ONLY website I can get firefox to load right now. I would attach screenshots but the website my screenshots get stored on WON'T load with firefox. I'm writing this from my macbook as, once again, firefox will not load any webpage I try to load up (except Society6 for whatever reason).

Any and all information/help would be greatly appreciated, i'm by no means a tech/computer guy so i'm really out of my element here. I'm more than happy to answer any further/clarifying questions people may have. Thank you.
creator: jocusmo

title: "Other Bookmarks" icon on Bookmarks Toolbar
content:
An "Other Bookmarks" labeled icon mysteriously appeared on my Bookmarks Toolbar. It sits just beyond/ to the right of the double overflow arrows. It's still in its normal place when I open the bookmarks, but that link sits there, taking up space. (It was never there before this evening.)

How do I remove it from that position? Can I simply delete the link? Or will that delete the entire Other Bookmarks folder/ the bookmarks within it?

How did it get there? How can I prevent its return? Please note my User Name when replying. Tech-speak is a foreign language which I have never studied.

title: Tab Groups - are they on the roadmap?
content:
Chrome has a really fantastic feature called "Tab Groups" - it's pretty self explanatory but it basically allows you to quickly group related sets of tabs.

This is an incredibly useful feature but it seems Firefox hasn't got anything like it.

I've tried a few of the third party add-ons such as Tree-Style-Tabs but they're all over-complicated, take up too much screen real estate or change the way tabs operate.

Is adding simple Tab Grouping functionality on the Firefox roadmap?

If not - has anyone found any good add-ons to replicate the Chrome functionality?
creator: smj3

title: marcadores
content: he tenido que formatear sin opcion de salvar nada, y al introducir mi cuenta de firefox en el navegador y sincronizar no recupero absolutamente nada, es como si nunca hubiese tenido la cuenta, ni marcadores ni contraseñas ni historial ni nada. ¿qué puedo hacer? ¿hay algun backup online? llevo años con la cuenta y ya la habiía restaurado previamente desde internet, sin archivo en el pc. (los marcadores no estan en ninguna carpeta) gracias a todos

title: Firefox acting weird?
content:
Not sure this is the right 'topic' but I just migrated all my info from my old MacBook Air to my new one, and Firefox is acting weird: I can go to various common websites, like salon and npr, but not, for example, slate.com.

Also, more importantly: 1. I can't even get to gmail. When I type 'gmail.com' in the brower, firefox does nothing. Even if I try a serach of 'gmail sign in' that will come up, but the link won't work?

2. Also, like, twitter won't work. Facebook I can get to my page but can click on anything, except if I try to message someone, it takes me to a blank page?

My Chrome browser is working, and my TOR browser as well.

Firefox is my prefered browser. What's going on? What should I do?

Thanks in advance!

John
